unnormalised: **Automotive News: Traffic Troubles & New Rules Brewing!**
normalised: **Automotive News: Traffic Troubles and New Rules Brewing!**

unnormalised: Heads up, Bangalore drivers! Things are about to get a bit different on our roads. The transport department is rolling out some new traffic regulations, just in time for the Onam rush!
normalised: Heads up, Bangalore drivers! Things are about to get a bit different on our roads. The transport department is rolling out some new traffic regulations, just in time for the Onam rush!

unnormalised: Seems like those pesky traffic jams are finally getting some attention. Sources say fines for speeding are going up – possibly as high as Rs. 5000 for repeat offenders. Think of all the biryani you could buy with that money!
normalised: Seems like those pesky traffic jams are finally getting some attention. Sources say fines for speeding are going up – possibly as high as rupee five thousand for repeat offenders. Think of all the biryani you could buy with that money!

unnormalised: Plus, there's talk of expanding the no-parking zones around MG Road and Brigade Road. So, maybe consider taking the metro instead, eh?
normalised: Plus, there's talk of expanding the no-parking zones around M G Road and Brigade Road. So, maybe consider taking the metro instead, eh?

unnormalised: And for two-wheeler riders, helmet rules are getting stricter. No more flimsy helmets folks! They're cracking down on ISI certification. Safety first, like our grandmothers always say.
normalised: And for two-wheeler riders, helmet rules are getting stricter. No more flimsy helmets folks! They're cracking down on I S I certification. Safety first, like our grandmothers always say.

unnormalised: Word on the street is that officials from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras helped formulate these new regulations.
normalised: Word on the street is that officials from the Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Madras helped formulate these new regulations.

unnormalised: The aim is to reduce accidents and ease congestion, especially during peak hours. They are planning on implementing the changes within the next two weeks.
normalised: The aim is to reduce accidents and ease congestion, especially during peak hours. They are planning on implementing the changes within the next two weeks.

unnormalised: We'll keep you posted on the exact details as they become available. Drive safe, folks! And happy Onam! Let's try to make this festive season less stressful on the roads.
normalised: We'll keep you posted on the exact details as they become available. Drive safe, folks! And happy Onam! Let's try to make this festive season less stressful on the roads.
